Package chess

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
chess.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains all common attributes and methods that belong to each Chess piece. This class is also used in the Board class to create the virtual Chess Board.
Author:
Savan Patel, Naveenan Yogeswaran

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece​(java.lang.String id, char color, char type, int col, int row, Board board)
      This constructor creates a Piece object with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the Piece. (Example: "wR", "bp", etc.).
      color - Which color the Piece belongs to ('w' = White or 'b' = Black).
      type - What type the Piece is ('p' = Pawn, 'Q' = Queen, 'K' = King, 'R' = Rook, 'N' = Knight, 'B' = Bishop).
      col - What column index the Piece is currently on in 'board' (0 to 7).
      row - What row index the Piece is currently on in 'board' (0 to 7).
      board - The Board object that the Piece belongs to.

    • isValid

      public abstract boolean isValid​(int rank, int file)
      Abstract method to be implemented by classes who inherit from Piece. This method will check if the passed row and column is a valid spot for the given Piece to move to.
      Parameters:
      rank - The inputed rank of the next position (0 to 7).
      file - The inputed file of the next position (0 to 7).
      Returns:
      True if the move is valid. False if the move is invalid.

    • movePiece

      public abstract int movePiece​(int rank, int file)
      Abstract method to be implemented by classes who inherit from Piece. This method will move Piece to the given rank and file.
      Parameters:
      rank - The inputed rank of the next position (0 to 7).
      file - The inputed file of the next position (0 to 7).
      Returns:
      2 if there is a checkmate. 1 if the move doesn't lead to checkmate but does lead to check. 0 if neither is true.
